name: SMART Technologies
overview: SMART Technologies ULC develops interactive whiteboards and group collaboration tools for classrooms and meeting rooms. The companyâ€™s products include SMART Board interactive whiteboards, which connects to computer and digital projector to show computer image to control computer applications from the display, write notes in digital ink, and save work to share later; and SMART Board software that offers tools and digital resources for presentations, and to create interactive content and manage work. Its products also include Sympodium interactive pen displays, which controls computer, and enables to control presentations; and Senteo interactive response system that provides wireless connection between the company and its students through radio frequency remote, central receiver, notebook whiteboarding software, and Senteo assessment software. In addition, the companyâ€™s products include AirLiner wireless slate that allows wireless interaction with SMART Board interactive whiteboard or Sympodium interactive pen display from; and Actalyst interactive digital signage, which transforms LCD and plasma panels into interactive information stations and wayfinders. Further, its products include SynchronEyes classroom management software that connects a teacher’s computer with various computers in a networked classroom; Bridgit conferencing software, which offers various ways to share voice, video, and data on the Internet; and SMART Ideas concept-mapping software that offers visual learning to classroom. The company offers its products through dealers in North America. It has strategic alliance with Intel Corporation. The company was founded as SMART Technologies, Inc. in 1987 and changed its name to SMART Technologies ULC in 2007. SMART Technologies ULC is headquartered in Calgary, Canada with additional offices in Germany, Japan, and China, as well as New York, New York; Chicago, Illinois; and Washington D.C.
